title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.1.9 ACCESS TO QUALITY EDU

description.narrative: Output 3.1.9 By the end of 2015, policies and strategies improved to support access to quality education for out-of-school children and children at risk of droping out (National, Aceh, Java, NTB, and Sulawesi), which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 3.1 By 2015, children and young people especially from vulnerable groups are empowered and equipped with adequate knowledge, basic education and life skills to cope with challenges and opportunities. (KRA 2,3)

mailing-address.narrative: 10th Floor Wisma Metropolitan 2 Jl. Jenderal Sudirman Jakarta 12920

sector.narrative: Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.
Provision of (formal and non-formal) primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.1.9 By the end of 2015, policies and strategies improved to support access to quality education for out-of-schoolchildren and children at risk of droping out (National, Aceh, Java, NTB, and Sulawesi)
Number of defined access-related education policies and strategies developed/revised that contribute to the reduction of out of school children (OOSC)

baseline.value: 0 (existing policies and strategies do not adequately prioritize OOSC problems and ensure transition of children to upper education level).

target.value: 2015:1 national policy and 1 strategy /guideline addressing barriers to transition to secondary education

actual.value: 2015:- Bupati instruction on Retrieval Programme is issued in Situbondo and local policy on OOSC has been issued in Brebes district as well. - Continous advocacy on the results of CBDIS data collection which among others highlights the issue of OOSC has motivated Back to School movement initiated by loca

title.narrative: Percentage of schools achieving minimum service standards in three districts in Aceh

baseline.value: Aceh Besar 24%, Aceh Jaya 28%, Aceh Timur 51%

actual.value: 2015:- National SBM Action Plan which includes Guidance for SBM Dissemination at Provincial and District Level, Guidance for SBM Implementation at School Level, and Guidance for SBM Technical Assistance, has been endorsed.- An SBM resource center as a knowledge management facility of SBM has been launch

title.narrative: Endorsed National guidelines on school-based management (SBM)

actual.value: 2015:2 national level policies give priority to OOSC (i.e. Smart Indonesia Programme that replaces Scholarship for the Poor Programme includes OOSC as one of its main beneficiaries, BOS programme is required to guarantee graduates of primary school to continue to junior secondary education.
